head.title: Waterproofing by injection
head.description: Cutting off the capillary rise of moisture

picture.title: Familiar picture?
picture.alt: Photo of mold on the wall

slider.content: Unpleasant odor, mold and mildew, peeling plaster, wallpaper, or paint, moisture stains inside the building or on the facade.

about.title: In most cases, these problems are a result of capillary rise of moisture through walls.
about.subtitle1: What is capillary rise of moisture?
about.content1: Capillary rise is the rise of moisture from the ground through the capillaries of walls (on the photo, this path is depicted by an arrow with the number 1).
about.content2: Moisture, rising from the ground, reaches the level of the first floor and brings with it the discomfort described above.
about.content3: Protection against capillary rise of moisture should be addressed during the construction stage by performing horizontal waterproofing, as shown in the photo.
about.content4: According to all existing norms, the performance of horizontal waterproofing is mandatory.
about.content5: However, unfortunately, very often during new construction, it is not done or is done insufficiently professionally.
about.content6: Or, if we are talking about an old building, such waterproofing may have been performed, but it has been destroyed over time.

what.title: What to do in such a case in an existing building?
what.alt: This picture shows the injection method
what.subtitle: Here comes the technology of injection to help.
what.content1: Drilling holes in the brickwork, blowing compressed air.
what.content2: Injection of a special waterproofing composition into the holes.
what.content3: Waiting for the holes to dry with a repair solution.
what.content4: Application of waterproofing over a series of injection holes.

grafic.title: This will allow you to establish a reliable barrier in the path of rising moisture and get rid of the problems it brings with it.

advantage.title: Advantages of this technology
advantage.content1: Effectively solves the problem of damp walls
advantage.content2: Can be done quickly without extensive repair work
advantage.content3: The results will be noticeable in the near future
advantage.content4: Capillary moisture isolation is maintained for decades
advantage.content5: The work can be carried out at any time of the year regardless of the ambient temperature
advantage.content6: Significant savings in material and labor costs as this method does not require excavation work

problem.title: And this will deinitely solve the problem ?
problem.content1: No, not exactly. Because the moisture can enter the room through at least four different paths (mapping by arrows on the drawing).
problem.content2: Therefore, in order to avoid mistakes and unnecessary costs, it is necessary to conduct a survey and accurately determine which of the paths we are dealing with at a particur facility.
problem.content3: You can contact our specialists, send photos/videos of your situation. We will professionally determine the heart of the problem and propose a technology for its solution.
